column1: Papaya—Average retail price per pound and per cup equivalent, 2016

1The USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR) reports that inedible seeds and skin account for 38 percent of the retail weight, implying a preparation yield of 62 percent, when eaten raw.
2Includes dried papaya in a variety of shapes like chunks, spears, or pieces.

Source: Calculated by USDA, Economic Research Service, from 2016 IRI Infoscan data; the USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR), Release 26; and the Food Patterns Equivalents Database (FPED) 2013-14 as well as the FPED's accompanying Methodology and User Guide.
